intro: Fleischmannia monagasensis, commonly known as the Monagasensis Fleischmannia, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in coastal areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
